author: Best Cherry Pie

review: This is a competitor to Roku and Chromecast. I have a few Roku boxes and I prefer the Fire Stick. First, the cost is great. It's less than the standard Roku (most of the time.) It's small--it fits right into your HDMI port, and an extender is included if you need it (depending on the configuration of what's already in your HDMI ports. I had to use the cable.)The Fire Stick arrives associated with your Amazon account and the interface is easy to use to set up your WiFi (I didn't have to scroll between numbers and letters, and it was very fast to use the on screen keyboard.)Some extra features: your Amazon Cloud Drive is available on the Fire Stick, so you can play your photos and videos easily. You can play Amazon music as well as Pandora.If you are a gamer, there are 500 games available and an optional Amazon Fire Game Controller although you can use the directional pad of the remote if you wish.Most streaming TV stations are here: HBO Go is not (but slated for later in 2015.)I found this easy to set up. Roku is not difficult at all, but this is even easier. While you don't need to have Amazon Prime to use this, definitely it's an advantage for Prime users, as you get the Prime TV, film and music.The remote is well-designed and seems more responsive than the Roku. The one disadvantage: if you have a TV that lacks HDMI ports, this is not for you. You don't get the ability to interface with a three-plug cable. For that, you need the old style Roku LT or similar device.Bottom line: price worthy, does a lot, excellent choice for Prime users. Requires an HDMI port.
